title: 108_hr4915
content: The "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004" is cited as the short title. It introduces an exclusion for gain from stock of small, publicly traded companies in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004" excludes gain from the sale of section 1203 stock held for over 1 year for non-corporate taxpayers. The exclusion is limited to $100,000 ($50,000 for married individuals filing separately). 1203 stock refers to stock in a qualified small business C corporation acquired after the enactment date, either for money, property, or as compensation for services. The "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004" excludes gain from the sale of section 1203 stock held for over 1 year for non-corporate taxpayers. The stock must be acquired for money, property, or as compensation for services, and publicly traded on recognized exchanges. The "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004" excludes gain from the sale of section 1203 stock held for over 1 year for non-corporate taxpayers. A qualified small business is defined as a domestic C corporation with a market capitalization not exceeding $150,000,000 at the time of stock acquisition. Market capitalization is determined by the closing price of a share of stock in the corporation. The amount for the acquisition of stock is determined by the closing price of a share of stock in the corporation and the number of outstanding shares. If this does not apply, it is based on the most recent amounts paid for each class of stock in the corporation. The rules for determining the amount for the acquisition of stock are based on the closing price of a share of stock and the number of outstanding shares. Additional rules apply for reporting periods and aggregation. The rules of section 1202(d)(3) apply, with additional rules from subsections (f), (g), (h), (i), (j), and (k) of section 1202, except for a modification in subsection (j)(1)(A). Conforming amendments are made to sections 642(c)(4) and 643(a)(3) of the Code. The curr_chunk is amended by inserting references to section 1203 in various sections of the Code. The curr_chunk is amended by inserting references to section 1203 in various sections of the Code, including changes to section 1202(b) and a clerical amendment to the table of sections. The amendments made by this section exclude gains from stock of small, publicly traded companies. Effective date applies to securities acquired after the enactment of this Act.
